Best game I have ever played. I didn't think it would be so much fun, but the story was wonderful and complex. The fun doesn't end in single-player, because you can then play co-op with friends, which is even better.

If you played the original Portal you will enjoy this new, expansion, version of the game. It has the same idea/game play as the first game. Very enjoyable and it makes you think outside the box.

If you didn't play the first game, I recommend you play it before starting this version. It isn't absolutely needed, but for continuity it would help the storyline along.

A+ again as this game is an instant classic.
Absolument magnifique !

Я не знаю, как описать эту игру так, чтобы не повторяться с другими обзорщиками. Она, несмотря на "тесность" вселенной - вся игра играется в лаборатории Aperture - умудрилась создать просто огромный фендом, и стать для многих "вратами" в игровую индустрию. 

Саундтрек, сюжет, юмор, головоломки Мастерской, фанатские моды - все это не раз заставит вас перепройти игру, либо поискать новые карты, либо просто найти кучу контента по вселенной Portal.

Чтобы не любить эту игру, нужно придираться к недостаткам, как чокнутому, но кому это надо? За всеми остальными качествами, вы будете просто отмахиваться от них
This is one best games of world. I like it.10/10

Starting out as not only being a vast improvement to the original portal graphics-wise but the story is far deeper than any other game i've played to date. Whilst making the puzzles even more mind boggling than before, the easter eggs are just as rewarding.

Srsly..Cannot say enough good things about Portal in general. You have to use your brain, and..it's funny as hell!  THE CAKE IS A LIE!!  One of my most loved games. Also, it's quite enjoyable that there is a 2 player function...hey, twice the brain power is ALWAYS a good thing, right??

I played Portal 1, and was so excited to play portal 2, but never got a chance to play it. Sadly college started, lost interest in PC gaming, and fast forward to now: the next gen consoles didnt wow me, especially with that required yearly online subscription fee and so i felt a PC revival coming back lol. Long story short, i fixed up my computer with some new parts, saw portal 2 on sale, and now after playing portal 2 and finishing it a few minutes ago, i just want to say what a great game and what seems to be a conclusion to the series. Sigh;(. Anyways, if you like puzzles, and a fun compelling story with awesome humor, (Glados) "clap clap" im a potato......(play the game and ull know what im referring to lol) then i highly recommend u play it! this is a game im happy to pay for and contribute to the developers;).... it feels so good to be back on PC's ;)

Note: if you havent played portal 1, then you should definitely play it before this one. The plot will make so much more sense;)

Now go play you can thank me later!
An improvement on the original, something I thought impossible. Excellent writing, entertaining story and challenging enough to be great fun!

Great sequel to one of my favorite surprise hits.  The sadistic, dry humor is back in full force and the expanded puzzle elements are a blast.  I've gotten a big kick out of the level editor as well as my kids.  Great game.

Portal 2 puts itself above and beyond itself compared to the first game, with the voice actors of GLADoS and Wheatley to guide you on your way of completing even more puzzles of SCIENCE!! Wish you had someone along for the ride, you can! unlike the first game, there is actually a co-op mode with its own story where you play one of two robots helping GLADoS with her science experiments. This is a valve classic to add to your collection, i highly recommend it

[i] Originally posted on May 13, 2011 [/i]

Portal 2 is a triumph. There's no getting around it, the game is simply exceptional. The writing, voice acting, humor, atmosphere, puzzle design, physics, and even graphics (in areas) are stellar. The game returns with a significantly longer but also more complex and more developed campaign, which sees Chell waking up within Aperture labs several hundred years after the events of portal. The atmosphere of decay really permeates the entire game.

The puzzles are surprisingly innovative. Valve has expertly integrated more small project ideas (like the gel) into portal, expanding the possibilities and factors present in test chambers. While it can seem overwhelmingly complex at first, you get used to it, and the feeling of accomplishment you get after completing some of the harder tests simply can't be beat. They've really done a lot by adding more and more elements to the tests, although it does make me wonder how many more new tests can really be created without being Repeats. I guess we'll see in the free DLC for coop.

Speaking of coop, while the coop campaign doesn't have much of a narrative, it's a blast to play. You really have to not only work together, but to think together as well in order to solve some of the harder tests. It's really fun to play with a friend over skype.

Overall though, Portal 2 is incredible, and it's really nothing less than I expected. You owe it to yourself to play this game.
Fun puzzle solving experience with an entertaining story as well.  There are loads of player made puzzles as well.  Solid game

Это уникальная игра. Здесь единственное оружие это ваша голова, и продолжительность кампании зависит только от вас (как одиночной, так и кооперативной). Так же здесь есть редактор своих тестовых комнат и поддержка Steam Workshop. В этой игре достаточно много юмора и сарказма, и в общей сложности после прохождения понимаешь, что каждая новая игра Valve - это выстрел. Выстрел в десяточку.
The cake is a lie ! :)

Portal 2 достойное продолжение оригинала. Проходить испытания используя старую добрую портальную пушку просто классно, на мой взгляд это лучшая головоломка от первого лица. В отличии от оригинала Portal 2 расширила кругозор в отношении испытаний добавив новые элементы помимо порталов, с ними испытание стали тежялее и изощерёнее. Моя оценка 5 из 5
Great storytelling, great voice actors. Less frustrating than Portal 1 since the puzzles are more about finding the correct solution and not skillfull navigation or good timing.
